required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

collaborator.agency: Basel Academy for Quality and Research in Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: Patients who were surgically treated with ACL reconstruction at a single clinic between 2013 and 2018 will be approached by a questionnaire regarding their return to sport after surgery. Questions will focus on the timepoint of the return, subsequent injuries, and the impact of the initial injury on the life of the patients. In addition, existing clinical data from the baseline visit and from the follow-up visits offered routinely to the patient will be used.

primary_outcome.time_frame: All patients will be asked in a cross sectional assessment, i.e. at one specific date (planned: May 31, 2021). The distance of this time point to the time of surgery will vary between 2 and 8 years.
primary_outcome.description: This will be based on a self reporting by the patient.

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of a subsequent injury after return to sport
primary_outcome.time_frame: All patients will be asked in a cross sectional assessment, i.e. at one specific date (planned: May 31, 2021). The distance of this time point to the time of surgery will vary between 2 and 8 years.
primary_outcome.description: This will be based on the self reporting by the patient

secondary_outcome.description: Muscle strength is assessed by considering the flexion/extension ratio. This data will be collected retrospectively form the medical records,

secondary_outcome.time_frame: All patients will be asked in a cross sectional assessment, i.e. at one specific date (planned: May 31, 2021). The distance of this time point to the time of surgery will vary between 2 and 8 years.
secondary_outcome.description: A series of questions about the impact of the injury on the life of the patients will be answered by the patients

study_pop.textblock: All patients of age ≥18, who had an ACL injury and were surgically treated with ACL reconstruction at the crossklinik or affiliated institutions between 1.1.2013 and 31.12.2018 by a small group of experienced surgeons will be included in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥18
- ACL injury
- surgically treated with ACL reconstruction at the crossklinik or affiliated institutions between 1.1.2013 and 31.12.2018
Exclusion Criteria:
- different treatment approach to the injury (e.g. conservative, stimulation of healing response, surgical treatment for re-rupture etc.).

patient_data.ipd_description: The data will be made available on request.
